meanings.definition: Of small size, weak or insignificant in comparison to others.
meanings.sent1: The ant was the puniest creature in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The smallest puppy in the litter was the puniest.
meanings.sent3: Even the puniest squirrel could outsmart the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was so puniest that it got lost in the noise.
meanings.sent5: The puniest candle can still light up a dark room.

meanings.sent1: The puniest effort was not enough to move the heavy rock.
meanings.sent2: The puniest superhero in the comic had trouble lifting a feather.
meanings.sent3: His puniest punch barely made a dent in the pillow.
meanings.sent4: The puniest battery couldn't power the toy for long.
meanings.sent5: Even the puniest gust of wind could knock over the tower of cards.

meanings.sent1: The puniest fabric tore easily with a gentle tug.
meanings.sent2: The puniest excuse couldn't justify his absence.
meanings.sent3: Her puniest painting was still better than my best attempt.
meanings.sent4: The puniest star in the sky still shines brightly.
meanings.sent5: Even the puniest flower adds beauty to the garden.
